issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: TestHDFSTrash fails because of TestTrash in common

comments.body:
Test is using Java File.list() method which works fine for LocalFileSystem. 
But the same test is being run in HDFS project with DFS and it failes. 
We need to change it to FileSystem.listStatus() , which works for both.

Ran testHDFSTrash on HDFS project..

run-test-hdfs:
   [delete] Deleting directory /Users/borya/work/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs/build/test/data
    [mkdir] Created dir: /Users/borya/work/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs/build/test/data
   [delete] Deleting directory /Users/borya/work/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs/build/test/logs
    [mkdir] Created dir: /Users/borya/work/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs/build/test/logs
    [junit] Running org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestHDFSTrash
    [junit] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 5.526 sec
I'd suggest to declare method's parameters final: it will improve readability and make testing easier.

test-patch:

     [exec] +1 overall.  
     [exec] 
     [exec]     +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.
     [exec] 
     [exec]     +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.
     [exec]

+1 on the new patch. I also manually tested that with the new jar TestHDFSTrash no longer fails.

 I'm not overly concerned with the non-final parameters as the function is just a few lines and the variables aren't being abused.  

Of note is the necessity of checking for null from listStatus.  This is to avoid the fact that the listStatus implementation differs between Local/ChecksumFileSystem and DistributedFileSystem.  I've opened HDFS-538 to address this.
I have committed this.  Thanks, Boris!

Integrated in Hadoop-Common-trunk #52 (See [http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Hadoop-Common-trunk/52/])
    . TestTrash uses java.io.File api but not hadoop FileSystem api.  Contributed by Boris Shkolnik
